intro: Nicotiana breviloba, commonly known as the shortleaf tobacco, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy habitats. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and moths, and it is known for its aromatic properties. Nicotiana breviloba is also a member of the nightshade family, Solanaceae, which includes other economically important plants like tomatoes and peppers.
